com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes: This card provides {C} Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card from that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
After counting your Prize cards, shuffle them into your deck. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards.
After counting your Prize cards, shuffle them into your deck. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards.
Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
This attack does 20 more damage for each {C} in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.
Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of {W} Energy attached to your Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 50 damage times the amount of {G} Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 3 cards.
This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
During your next turn, you may attach any number of Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon.
Discard a {G} Energy and a {L} Energy from this Pokémon.
During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of your Benched Pokémon and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
This attack does 20 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.
During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.
Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 50 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched {R} Pokémon.
This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Discard all Special Energy from each Pokémon.
The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.
Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.
This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.
Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Discard any amount of {F} Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Search your deck for a Dratini, a Dragonair, and a Dragonite, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.
Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.
This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Heal 20 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.
Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and return it to your hand. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or on the turn this Pokémon was put into play.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a {P} Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Then, discard a card from it.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a {G} Energy card and a {L} Energy card and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is {C} more.
Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, their new Active Pokémon is Poisoned.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's {R} Pokémon.
When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
customchoice.sm1_20.queenlymajesty: Would you like your opponent to reveal their hand?
playmat.prompt.sm1_12.featherarrow: Choose a Pokémon to put 2 damage counters on.
playmat.prompt.sm1_12.hollowhuntgx: Choose 3 cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm1_38.courier: Choose a Benched Pokémon to put into your hand. All cards attached to it will also be put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm1_48.vividcharge: Choose up to 3 Basic Energy cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm1_52.strongchargel: Choose a {L} Energy to attach to 1 of your Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm1_66.lunarfallgx: Choose a Basic Pokémon to Knock Out. (It can't be a Pokémon-GX.)
playmat.prompt.sm1_66.psychictransferb: Choose a Pokémon to move the {P} Energy to.
playmat.prompt.sm1_71.rockartillery: Choose any amount of {F} Energy to discard. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discard in this way.
playmat.prompt.sm1_77.evilorders: Choose cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm1_94.signsofevolution: Choose a Dratini, Dragonair, and Dragonite to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm1_96.dragonwave: Choose a {G} Energy and a {L} Energy to discard.
product.sm1.booster.description: Welcome to the tropical Alola region! Start your journey with Rowlet, Litten, and Popplio, then seek out the Legendary Pokémon Solgaleo-GX and Lunala-GX to witness the awesome power of a new kind of Pokémon: each Pokémon-GX brings an attack so devastating that you can use only one of them per game! Discover dozens of never-before-seen Pokémon, Alola forms of some familiar favorites, and new ways to battle in the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon expansion!
specialvisualizations.hexmaniac: This player's Pokémon in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities.
specialvisualizations.player.cannotdraws: This player can't draw a card at the beginning of their turn.
specialvisualizations.player.cannotplayt: This player can't play Trainer cards.
specialvisualizations.player.nopokepower: This player can't use any of their Pokémon's Poké-Powers.
specialvisualizations.sm1_108.echoedvoic: This Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does more damage.
specialvisualizations.sm1_58.powerofalch: Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile have no Abilities.
specialvisualizations.sm1_95.dragonswish: You may attach any number of Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon.
